articles.title: Coaching is about saying the right thing at the right time: Rumesh Ratnayake
articles.summary: The 62-year-old knows a thing or two about famous Sri Lankan victories. He took the wicket that won the island nation its first-ever Test and coached the women to significant overseas T20I series wins and an Asia Cup triumph. He talks about his coaching philosophy, being inspired by the All Blacks, the evolution of the women’s game and his time as a pathbreaking quick

articles.title: Pietersen wants IPL and PSL-winning coach to replace McCullum
articles.summary: After England’s 4-1 Ashes loss to Australia, Kevin Pietersen called for changes in the coaching setup and backed former coach Andy Flower as a possible replacement for Brendon McCullum. Calling it a “wild thought,” Pietersen said Flower has evolved and understands modern players. Flower previously led England to major successes and has since won titles in the PSL, The Hundred and IPL.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: ASHES QUIZ: Test your knowledge from this winter's Test series
articles.summary: England fans may wish to forget their team's 4-1 series defeat in Australia - but much do you remember about the Ashes just gone?

articles.title: Dante Moore and the Oregon Ducks self-destruct in 56-22 Peach Bowl loss to No. 1 Indiana
articles.summary: The very first snap of the Peach Bowl pretty much summed up what kind of night it would be for Oregon.  A pick-6 put Dante Moore and the Ducks in an immediate hole.  No. 1 Indiana romped into the national championship game with a 56-22 blowout of fifth-seeded Oregon in the College Football Playoff semifinal on Friday, a one-sided affair that was essentially over by the time the Ducks dragged themselves to the locker room — presumably to discuss seating arrangements for the long flight home even
articles.author: PAUL NEWBERRY

articles.title: Sponsors pull back, futures clouded: Bangladesh cricketers caught in India standoff
articles.summary: Bangladesh cricket faces uncertainty as Indian sponsorship deals for players like Litton Das are at risk following the Mustafizur Rahman controversy. The Bangladesh Cricket Board has requested the International Cricket Council shift T20 World Cup matches from India to Sri Lanka due to security concerns, impacting players and coaching staff.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Interesting transition phase in Indian cricket... between Gambhir and senior players: Graeme Smith
articles.summary: The start of the 2026 T20 World Cup is less than a month away and Smith wants his team to beat India in the final of the multi-nation tournament. Speaking on the sidelines of the ongoing SA20, league commissioner Smith said the Proteas have all bases covered with their squad.
articles.author: Sahil Malhotra

articles.title: SA20: 'Commercially, we're having our strongest year' - Graeme Smith
articles.summary: SA20 League Commissioner Graeme Smith says the tournament is enjoying its strongest commercial year yet, driven by record ticket sales, rising viewership and improved cricket quality. Despite rain interruptions, Smith credits IPL franchise backing, youth development and strong fan engagement for SA20’s rapid growth, while hinting at future expansion and a possible women’s league.
articles.author: Sahil Malhotra

articles.title: Vastrakar out of the WPL for two weeks with hamstring injury
articles.summary: Misfortune strikes RCB fast bowler Pooja Vastrakar, who was on the road to recovery from a shoulder injury but now needs more time

articles.title: Thirty years ago, a punt helped the country to World Cup triumph
articles.summary: To win a Cricket World Cup, all your elements — batting, bowling and fielding — need to collectively work well. Consistency in team efforts, along with a few individuals’ standout performances, makes a team the World Champion. But sometimes a decision, technical or tactical, during the buildup to such a mega event turns out to be a trump card for the team, leading them to massive success.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Atherton: Ashes defeat will 'haunt England for years'
articles.summary: Michael Atherton fears England will be "haunted" by their latest Ashes failure for years to come.

articles.title: Winning in England will be Australia's next goal - McGrath column
articles.summary: After a comfortable 4-1 series win in the Ashes, Australia's next goal will be winning in England for the first time in 26 years when they tour next summer, says Glenn McGrath.

articles.title: Quick reaction: Indiana beats Oregon – a second time – 56-22
articles.summary: Indiana advances to the National Championship with a blowout win over the Oregon Ducks

articles.title: WPL: Nadine de Klerk difference between MI and win; RCB pocket opener
articles.summary: Royal Challengers Bengaluru Women began their WPL 2026 campaign with a thrilling three-wicket win over Mumbai Indians in Navi Mumbai. Chasing 155, Nadine de Klerk starred with an unbeaten 63 and hit the winning boundary off the last ball. “It was De Klerk's night in Navi Mumbai,” the commentator roared. Earlier, MI posted 154, with Sajeevan Sajana and Nicola Carey leading the charge.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Keep McCullum? Cook as assistant? - Questions for England after Ashes defeat
articles.summary: With England left to lick their wounds after yet another Ashes drubbing in Australia, we look at the most pressing questions facing the team as they address the fallout from their 4-1 series defeat...

articles.title: Mendoza, Indiana oust Oregon to reach first college football finale
articles.summary: Indiana defenders feasted on early Oregon turnovers to build a big lead they never surrendered en route to a 56-22 thrashing in Friday's Peach Bowl.

articles.title: 2026 Men's T20 World Cup - squads
articles.summary: Find out who is in each squad for the Men's T20 World Cup which begins on 7 February.

articles.title: 'It will take couple of days for win to sink in': Nadine de Klerk
articles.summary: Nadine de Klerk starred in Royal Challengers Bangalore's dramatic three-wicket WPL opener win against Mumbai Indians. She took 4/26 with the ball and then smashed an unbeaten 63, securing player-of-the-match. De Klerk credited backing her strengths for the decisive performance in the thrilling last-ball victory.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Virat turns entertainer in training, mimics Arshdeep; Rohit reacts - WATCH
articles.summary: Virat Kohli exuded a relaxed and cheerful demeanor as India began preparations for the ODI series against New Zealand.  During training, Kohli playfully mimicked Arshdeep Singh's run-up, drawing laughter from teammates. Senior batters Kohli and Rohit Sharma focused on rigorous practice, preparing for a demanding schedule ahead.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Adair returns to Ireland squad for T20 World Cup
articles.summary: Ireland include opener Ross Adair in a 15-man squad for next month's T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka.

articles.title: De Klerk comes clutch as RCB steal last-ball thriller against Mumbai Indians
articles.summary: RCB needed 18 off the final over with three wickets left, but de Klerk pulled off another heist against a Harmanpreet Kaur-led team

articles.title: Lancs hand two-year contract to all-rounder Shetty
articles.summary: Arav Shetty is rewarded for some promising displays in 2025 with a new two-year contract by Lancashire.

articles.title: WPL Season 4: De Klerk pulls off a heist for Royal Challengers Bengaluru
articles.summary: The South African plunders 20 off the last over bowled by Sciver-Brunt to snatch a three-wicket win after Sajana and Carey’s audacious strokeplay lifts the defending champion to 154

articles.title: Arsenal have a Viktor Gyokeres problem and Mikel Arteta’s next move is clear

articles.title: Virat Kohli eyeing yet another Sachin Tendulkar record in India-New Zealand ODI series
MI vs RCB highlights, WPL 2026: With 20 runs off final 4 balls, Nadine de Klerk helps RCB win by 3 wickets
'Decisions today will echo for 10 yrs': Ex-captain Tamim warns Bangladesh
articles.summary: Former Bangladesh captain Tamim Iqbal urged the BCB to carefully consider the national team's T20 World Cup participation, warning against hasty decisions driven by public emotion. He emphasized prioritizing Bangladesh cricket's long-term future and suggested dialogue over public pronouncements. Iqbal stressed the BCB's need for independent decision-making while acknowledging government involvement.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Jefferson-Wooden’s plan for world domination centres on ‘Melissa’
articles.summary: A switch in the 24-year-old American sprinter’s focus — from competing against others to competing against her best — brought rich rewards in 2025. The reigning sprint queen, who claimed a historic triple crown at the Worlds, wants to establish herself among the greatest ever as she looks forward to a series of major events culminating in Los Angeles 2028
